title: EPSS-Based Intensive Short-Term Instructional Design Course for Mathematics Teaching: Focused on Calculations, Formulas, Equations, and Proofs

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (calculations, formulas, equations, graph interpretation) and intermediate-level application skills (problem-solving, data analysis). Knowledge of foundational statistics and probability concepts
context.additional_context: Operating project-based assessments using personal devices (tablets/laptops). Emphasizing real-world math problem-solving skills (statistical analysis, probability modeling, data visualization) to achieve learning objectives, with a focus on cultivating logical thinking through proof processes.

learning_goals: Complete the lesson design process for equation solving, graph analysis, and mathematical proofs by at least 80% using EPSS components (tutorials, examples, resources, etc.)
Develop at least three interactive mathematical learning materials (e.g., problem-solving simulations, statistical visualization tools, probability distribution generators) using built-in EPSS tools

Submit a mathematical modeling project (including at least three modeling stages and statistical/probability analysis) within one week, incorporating three peer reviews and two self-assessments, achieving at least 80% attainment in four out of five rubric criteria
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
